stream_context.summary: Kaze works on Bozo’s Oil Rig, focusing on a new wet-cement mechanic, a construction-worker Koopa NPC, and a container-style redesign of the Tox Box enemy.  He also discusses engine optimisations, remaining N64 crashes, and an overworld economy system.

development_findings.summary: Implemented a wet-cement system: Mario’s ground-pound and dive leave a butt/footprint decal that darkens with repeated contact, using a 12×12 I4 texture (2 pixels/byte) and separate routines for odd/even pixels.
development_findings.quote: Sometimes when we ground-pound we’re at an odd number of pixels, so we have to add two different bytes instead of the same byte twice.

development_findings.summary: Bug in footprint rendering traced to a missing texture-width/offset line; fixed by duplicating the half-width calculation across both even and odd branches.
development_findings.quote: That part was missing everywhere—no wonder this didn’t work.

development_findings.summary: Zeina delivered the butt-print sprite; Kaze integrated it and iterated on cement textures to achieve a visible but N64-friendly look.

Modelled a ‘tired’ construction-worker Koopa (≈328 tris) with a Bowser-branded hard-hat, custom shell/boot colours, and planned animation list (idle, talk, angry, carry-glass, upset, walk, fall/slide).
development_findings.quote: Any change requests, speak your mind now or shut up forever.

development_findings.summary: Planned fence around the cement pit so Mario visibly breaks site rules and upsets the Koopa.
Redesigned Tox Boxes as metal shipping-container cubes with faces, inspired by ChatGPT suggestions; faces will be symmetrical, texture sourced from container photos.
development_findings.quote: In the oil-rig theme you could redesign them as large shipping containers… I actually like ChatGPT.

development_findings.summary: Overworld economy agreed with Biobak: global coins buy temporary ‘Power Star’ assists, donate to NPCs to change the hub world, and purchase Yoshi Coins.
development_findings.quote: We’ve come to a pretty good agreement… you’ll be able to donate to characters so you can see the overworld change while you play.

development_findings.summary: Created a highly optimised atan2s routine; peers compared it to academic papers.
development_findings.quote: Someone sent me a paper and then realised, oh wait—you did the same thing.

development_findings.summary: Beta builds run smoothly but still crash frequently on real N64 hardware; crash-hunting is a release blocker.
development_findings.quote: While it runs super well when it runs, there’s still a lot of crashes… I need to figure those out before we can release.

development_findings.summary: Maintains strict poly/texture budgets to keep future multiplayer viable; Koopa worker kept at ~328 triangles.

context_findings.summary: Streamed shirtless due to European heatwave; no AC, only ceiling fan. Mentions recent beach trips.
context_findings.quote: I am basically just dying right now from all the heat.

context_findings.summary: Coding philosophy: ignores style guides; only cares if compiler passes.
context_findings.quote: If the compiler doesn’t see a difference, I also don’t see a difference.

context_findings.summary: Motivation is intrinsic; earnings are low compared to possible industry jobs but he prefers creative freedom and channel growth.
context_findings.quote: I would make a lot more money if I just did literally anything else with my skills.

context_findings.summary: Expressed frustration at GCC ‘undefined reference’ bug and at Twitch ads; prefers YouTube but dislikes its latency.
Proud, almost giddy, when major bugs or optimisations land (footprints, atan2s).

biobak.summary: Debated overworld redesign with Kaze via DMs; agreed on coin-based store/donation system.
biobak.quote: I’ve had some arguments with Biobak… I think we’ve come to a pretty good agreement.

zeina.summary: Provided the butt-print graphic and will animate the construction Koopa per Kaze’s specification list.
zeina.quote: I’m sending you all of Wario’s animations… including a funny little walk cycle.

key_stories.title: Cracking the Cement Footprint Bug
key_stories.summary: Kaze wanted Mario’s ground-pound to leave realistic footprints in wet cement. Initial renders looked corrupted; half of the prints were missing or offset.
key_stories.challenge: Handling I4 textures where two pixels share a byte caused even/odd addressing errors.
key_stories.process: Debugged texture offsets, discovered a missing width calculation duplicated across branches, and corrected texture index math.
key_stories.outcome: Footprints now render correctly, darken over time, and integrate Zeina’s custom sprite.
key_stories.key_quote: That part was missing everywhere—no wonder this didn’t work.

key_stories.title: Accidental State-of-the-Art atan2s
key_stories.summary: While profiling, Kaze rewrote the game’s angle-calculation routine. Discord peers linked an academic paper showing the same approach.
key_stories.challenge: Need for a faster angle lookup for performance on N64 hardware.
key_stories.process: Hand-optimised the math, reducing divisions and table lookups.
key_stories.outcome: Routine considered ‘state-of-the-art’ within hobbyist N64 circles; may become a standalone video topic.
key_stories.key_quote: Look at my atan2s code—I think I accidentally made a state-of-the-art programming code.

key_stories.title: Designing the Overworld Economy
key_stories.summary: Kaze and Biobak sparred over how to make the hub feel alive and player-friendly.
key_stories.challenge: Balancing accessibility for weaker players with meaningful progression.
key_stories.process: Debated coin persistence, power-star assists, and environmental changes via donations.
key_stories.outcome: Agreed system: global coins, optional star power-up, donate to remodel overworld, plus collectible Yoshi Coins.
key_stories.key_quote: You’ll be able to buy a Power Star… and donate to characters so you can see the overworld change while you play.
